monogr.author: Studley, Christopher

div.head: ¶ The Coppie of a letter sent from a Gentleman in Scotland to a frend of his in England, touching the conspiracie against the kings maiestie.
div.p: There hath beene lately secret practising against the kinges Maiestie of Scotland. But time serueth not nowe to set down the maner of their proceeding in the said attempt: I haue here sent to you the Kinges declaration to his last Acts of Parliament, and for breuitie haue set downe the names of the conspirators, which are as followeth. And thus in hope you will accept my good will, I commit you to the Almightie:

list.head: These wer apprehēded at ye kinges Court.

postscript.p: Iohn Hoppingell of the Mores apprehended at his owne house by the Captaine of the kings Garde.
The Lord Keir & Lord Maius apprehended with other Gentlemen about Sterling.
The Lord Blaketer and Georg Douglasse are sommoned to the Court vpon suspition.

The Lord Don Whasell.
The Lord Maius executed.
The treason discouered by Robert Hamelton.
